entry.title: FSLabs Updates A321ceo & neo for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. FSLabs has recently issued a new experimental update to their A321ceo and ceo for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, focusing on increasing stability, improving visual performance, and improving the handling, among other things. Update v11.0.1.309 aims to improve performance and lower VRAM usage, ensuring better headroom for users running very high resolutions or rocking cards with little VRAM to spare. Such extra headroom should warrant better stability in video memory-constrained environments, like approaching a demanding airport on top of a photogrammetric area. They have also mitigated certain CTDs that occasionally happen with very specific TCAS traffic situations and aircraft reloads. The steps taken to mitigate those should increase the overall robustness of their code, making it much more reliable. FSLabs has also worked on correcting an issue affecting the yaw behavior during the landing roll and retuning brake effectiveness based on measured stopping distances from real aircraft. entry.title: Horizon Simulations Provides Update on 787 Version 2 for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Horizon Simulations has shared a comprehensive development update on its freeware Boeing 787 project for MSFS 2020 and MSFS 2024, detailing some of the big improvements of the upcoming Version 2. Acknowledging a period of silence, Horizon Simulations explained that the team is entirely volunteer-based, balancing development with personal obligations. As a result, they avoid setting deadlines. However, they plan to share regular content updates moving forward, including monthly posts and in-depth âdevelopment divesâ, highlighting features of the upcoming Version 2 release. Version 2 of the Horizon 787 will feature a major overhaul for all three variants, the 787-8, 787-9, and 787-10, with a focus on a significantly revised external model. Other enhancements include a new custom cabin and numerous visual and functional refinements. Among the key upgrades are accurately modelled CAC inlet doors that respond dynamically to environmental, hydraulic and engine conditions, as well as support for line number variations that reflect subtle real-world differences between each airframe. Engine animations have also been redesigned, with revised spool-up dynamics and improved visual effects between the Trent 1000 and GEnx powerplants. Other notable additions include a functioning APU door, a reworked vertical stabiliser, new lighting with shadow effects for more realistic reflections, and detailed control surface behaviour when hydraulic power is not available, including aileron, flaperon, and elevator droop, along with rudder deflection induced by wind. While the update does not provide a release timeline, Horizon Simulations emphasised that development is active and ongoing. Further details, including sounds, systems, and additional model improvements, are expected in future posts. For all the latest in flight simulation, be sure to stay updated here on Threshold! entry.title: X-Codr Designs Updates Living Scenery Technology to Version 1.12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Living Scenery Technology, a free ground traffic plugin for XP11 and XP12, has recently been updated to version 1.12. The release introduces several new features and fixes, aimed at improving realism and flexibility for developers. Designed to animate moving objects within sceneries, such as people, cars, and ground traffic, the plugin provides a versatile system for developers to create dynamic environments. Among the most notable additions is the "MINSPACING" command, which enables developers to set a minimum distance between vehicles on a route. Vehicles now decelerate gradually and stop if they get too close, simulating traffic jams and stoplights more accurately. Support for dataref operations has also been further improved, with an optional priority system. This resolves previous conflicts when multiple operations targeted the same dataref, allowing for more controlled animations, such as preventing vehicles from driving through occupied crosswalks, or managing door behaviour based on other traffic conditions. The update also further refines acceleration and deceleration logic. Rather than stopping and starting abruptly, vehicles now adjust speed smoothly based on waypoint conditions, resulting in more believable traffic flow. Additionally, version 1.12 introduces the âDREFCYCLEâ command, which cycles a dataref through a specified pattern, ideal for features like animated jetways. The update is available for download via X-Plane.org. Be sure to stay up to date with all the latest flight simulation news, right here on Threshold! entry.title: Orbx Releases S43 Harvey Field and W16 Monroe Firstair for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Orbx recently released their rendition of S43 Harvey Field and W16 Monroe Firstair for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, which improves on the 2020 version. Harvey Airfield is a privately-owned public-use airport in Snohomish (WA), categorized on the FAA's National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems as a regional reliever facility. It was established in 1944 by the Harvey Family, getting a restaurant, an administration building, and a maintenance shop in 1947.Â It is mainly used for flight training in general aviation airplanes and helicopters, and offers fuel and aircraft maintenance. Monroe First Air Field is a public-use airport owned by the Washington State Department of Transportation. It opened in 1930 as a private airfield for Monroe Aircraft Corporation and was utilized in the following decade as a training base for the US Army.Â The post-war period saw the airfield become a general aviation facility, which continues to this day, even after it was acquired by the Washington State Department of Transportation in 1980. Despite being small, it's considered a very important part of the state's history for its many purposes over its nearly 100 years of existence. The scenery features a reedition of a FSX/P3D classic ported initially to 2020 and now revamped for 2024 in its full glory, with dynamic night lighting, full PBR UHD texturing, high-detailed models, and more. It's available on OrbxDirect for roughly $16.40, requiring at least 4.62 GB of free hard disk space to install (owners of the 2020 version get it for free). entry.title: Fly 2 High Releases Tulsa International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Fly 2 High has recently released their rendition of Tulsa International Airport (KTUL) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The airport serves Tulsa, Oklahoma, and has a yearly average of 3.2 million passengers. The airport opened nearly a hundred years ago, in 1928, as Tulsa Municipal Airport. Its initial infrastructure was rather rough, with a one-story wood and tar âterminalâ and landing strips and taxiways made of mown grass. It was busy enough at the time to be the âbusiest airport in the World,â handling nearly 10,000 passengers a month, somehow outpacing Croydon Airport in London, Berlin Tempelhof, and Paris Le Bourget. In the early 1930s, Frederick Kershner designed a new terminal with an elegant Art Deco design, no more wood and tar. That building soldiered on until the 1950s, when the administration realized it was no longer sufficient for the traffic figures, leading to the construction of a new terminal in 1958. The new â and much bigger â terminal opened in 1961, qualifying it to become an International airport two years later. It hosted the 130th Fighter Wing in 1940 during the early stages of World War 2. Within a year of that, the War Department determined that Tulsa would become the site of an Air Force Plant, operated by Douglas Aircraft Corporation to manufacture and assemble bombers from 1942 to 1945. A year after the war, American Airlines purchased two ex-Air Force hangars to start their maintenance facilities in Tulsa, where they had nonstop routes to Los Angeles and San Francisco. In the 1960s, McDonnell Douglas still used the Air Force Plant for aircraft maintenance. The lease ended in 1996, when Boeing acquired it for aerospace manufacturing. The passenger terminal was renovated in the 2010s, designed by Gensler and Benham Companies. The ceilings were raised, passenger waiting areas were improved, and the gates were redesigned. Itâs a hub for Omni Air International and Allegiant Air, American Airlines, American Eagle, Delta Air Lines, Delta Connection, Frontier Airlines, Southwest Airlines, United Airlines, and United Express serve it. â The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with a high-quality terminal model and its respective interior, custom jetways, custom taxiway labels, custom ground markings, and more. â Itâs available on SimMarket (2020 / 2024) for roughly $21.63, requiring at least 2.87 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: Just Flight Releases Fly the Line â Short Haul Edition
entry.summary: Sim: OTHER. Just Flight has released Fly the Line â Short Haul Edition,Â a standalone application designed to introduce structured, career-based progression to the flight simulation experience. Being compatible with all major platforms, including MSFS 2020, MSFS 2024, X-Plane 11, X-Plane 12, Prepar3D v4 through v6, and Flight Simulator X, the program offers a versatile and personalised short-haul airline experience. Fly the Line allows you to assume the role of a short-haul airline pilot, starting as a Junior First Officer and advancing toward the rank of Fleet Captain. Career progression is guided by performance across scheduled flights, with players earning cash, XP, and skill points to unlock new abilities, lifestyle improvements, and boost well-being, factors that influence job effectiveness. The application features three distinct game modes: Career Mode, where you build an airline career with generated routes and weekly schedules; Free Play Mode, which offers access to all features from the start, and Schedule Mode, focusing solely on realistic schedules and immersive flying, without the progression mechanics. You can create up to eight personalised pilot profiles and 16 aircraft profiles, each with its own schedules and data. Route generation is based on real-world airline data, and offers short- to medium-haul sectors, ranging from 30 minutes to around six hours. The software also includes dynamic diversions, sightseeing flights, side jobs, and a progression system that unlocks over 30 pilot skills. Lifestyle upgrades, such as home furnishings and sim pit setups, appear in a 3D-rendered home environment. Each flight is logged in a logbook, detailing performance metrics and feedback on landing quality, as well as other parameters. You can also create a custom airline, using any aircraft. Fly the Line is available from the Just Flight store for $39.99 USD. The program comes with an installer and includes built-in tutorials. entry.title: SimWorks Studios Provides Update on Airvan, PC-12 and More, for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. SimWorks Studios has recently issued a development update on social media, outlining progress across several ongoing projects, including the GA8 Airvan, PC-12, and FS2024 upgrades for the Kodiak series. Firstly, the developer stated that the MSFS 2020 version of the GA8 Airvan is nearing release, with the developer confirming that initial copies have already been distributed to ten users, ahead of launch. The MSFS 2024 variant is currently feature-complete; however, its release has been deferred by approximately one month to allow for additional testing following the rollout of Sim Update 3. Accompanying documentation, including the aircraft manual and a failures supplement for the SystemsPulse system, will be published next week, alongside the product page of the GA8. SimWorks Studios also stated that the Airvan will be released via the Microsoft Marketplace to begin with, with a direct store launch planned for a later date. The developer also shared updates on the Pilatus PC-12. The interior model rework has been completed, and is now entering the testing phase. In addition to improving FS2024 compatibility, the updated model features adapted Level of Detail (LOD) variants for better performance and reduced file size. The new cabin has seamless textures and enhanced customisability, allowing for more detailed liveries. Work on the PC-12 exterior model is expected to begin next week, with a teaser of the NG variant planned at a later date. SimWorks Studios is also working to enable hot-swapping between avionics configurations, the GNS, GTN and GTNXi, using the tablet system from the Airvan, which will be ported over to the PC-12. In closing, the developer noted continued progress on making both the Kodiak 100 and 900 compatible with MSFS 2024, with more news expected soon.
